summary: The headline numbers for Packaging Corp. (PKG) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended June 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

headline: Packaging Corp. (PKG) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Packaging Corp. (PKG) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.64% and +0.49%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Packaging Corp forecasts profit below estimates on export, freight pressures
summary: Packaging Corp of America forecast third-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, hurt by rising freight costs and weak export containerboard sales amid global trade uncertainty. The Lake Forest, Illinois-based company specializes in delivering paper and packaging products catering to a range of sectors, including the food and beverage industry, paper manufacturing, and retail commerce. While demand for packaging goods is recovering from a post-pandemic slowdown, sticky inflation and cautious consumer sentiment have pressured sales, especially while its customers navigate trade uncertainties due to tariffs.

headline: Packaging Corporation of America (NYSE:PKG) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates
summary: Packaging Corporation of America (NYSE:PKG) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 4.6% year on year to $2.17 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.48 per share was 1.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Packaging Corporation of America Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: LAKE FOREST, Ill., July 23, 2025--Packaging Corporation of America (NYSE: PKG) today reported second quarter 2025 net income of $242 million, or $2.67 per share, and net income of $224 million, or $2.48 per share, excluding special items. Second quarter net sales were $2.2 billion in 2025 and $2.1 billion in 2024.

raw.headline: Packaging Corporation of America Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
raw.summary: LAKE FOREST, Ill., July 23, 2025--Packaging Corporation of America (NYSE: PKG) today reported second quarter 2025 net income of $242 million, or $2.67 per share, and net income of $224 million, or $2.48 per share, excluding special items. Second quarter net sales were $2.2 billion in 2025 and $2.1 billion in 2024.
